title: Coding Labs
text:
Personal Portfolio
From this lab I learned how to use Quarto and build a website using Github.




Minnesota Tree Growth
In this lab, I learned how to use essential dplyr functions including filter, mutate, and rename.




COVID Wrangling
In the COVID wrangling lab I learned how to make a flextable.




LTER Network Data
In lab 4 I learned how to conduct statistical tests such as t.test or shapiro.test on a data set.




Final Project Proposals
In lab 5 I learned how to make a Quarto manuscript and use Quarto to create a citations page.




Machine Learning in Hydrology
In lab 6 I learned how to use workflows.




Project Kickoff
In lab 7 I expanded upon what was created in lab 5 for the course‚Äôs final project.




Machine Learning
In lab 8 I learned how to tune a model created with tidymodels.




Project Updates
In lab 9 I expanded upon what was created in lab 5 for the course‚Äôs final project.




Distance to The Border
In lab 10 I learned how to use sf_distance to calculate the distance between two places in an sf object.




Lightning Talk
For lab 11 my group mates and I gave a lightning talk to our lab section on urban population density vs access to open spaces.

title: Welcome
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Rachel üëã
Welcome to my personal website. I‚Äôm a 4th year student at Colorado State University studying Ecosystem Science and Sustainability. I am interested in environmental compliance, GIS, ornithology, and restoration.

title: GIS Portfolio
text: The following layout was created for my final project in NR 319, Introduction to Geospatial Sciences for Natural Resources, in the Fall of 2024. The goal of the project was to practice all of the GIS skill acquired throughout the course, including spatial analysis, cartography, and real-world application of spatial data.

title: GIS Portfolio
text:
World Travel
When given the opportunity to ‚Äúchoose my own geospatial adventure‚Äù in NR 493, Seminar on GIS and Remote Sensing Applications, I decided to fine tune my cartography skills and create a product that is both informational and visually appealing. I collected the data, years and places my grandmother has traveled, then joined it to a world countries polygons layer. I then used creative style packages and techniques from John Nelson, Esri cartographer, to create the following. I will be collecting feedback and improving this map Fall 2025.


What‚Äôs Next
Fall of 2025 I will be taking NR450, Geospatial Project Design and Analysis, where I will develop and execute an independent project on wildlife habitat fragmentation due to oil and gas infrastructure in Weld County, Colorado.

title: Projects
text: Below is ‚ÄúPerceived Environmental Responsibility: How Undergraduate Students‚Äô Educational and Social Background Influences Their Role in Addressing Sustainability Challenges‚Äù. This mixed methods research report was created for ESS 312, Sustainability Science.

title: Projects
text:
Course Development
I have created content to two masters-level courses for a developing program in the Natural Resources Recreation and Tourism department at Colorado State University. Thank you to Dr.¬†Stu Cottrell for the opportunity to contribute to this.



Science and Democracy
The following is a proposal created in CO 301B, Writing in the Sciences, to argue for the Way Cup initative created by Wolverine Farm Publick House to be implemented across all coffee shops in the City of Fort Collins.

title: About
text:
About Me
I‚Äôm a 4th year student at Colorado State University studying Ecosystem Science and Sustainability. I‚Äôm originally from the seacoast of New Hampshire, but came out to Colorado for school. I am interested in environmental compliance, GIS, ornithology, and restoration.
Here is a picture of me hiking outside of Leadville, CO!
